import React from 'react' import Sidebar from '../../components/sidebar/Sidebar' import Navsection from '../../components/navbar/Navsection' import './chapter2.scss' import { useNavigate } from "react-router-dom" import SyntaxHighlighter from 'react-syntax-highlighter'; import {far} from 'react-syntax-highlighter/dist/esm/styles/hljs'; const Chapter2 = () => { const obj1= ` ` // ---------------- const navigate = useNavigate(); const transfer = (txt) => { if (txt.includes(":)")) { setTimeout(() => navigate('/'), 500); } } const submit = (e) => { e.preventDefault(); const code = document.getElementById("input").value; const data = { code: code }; fetch('/api/code2', { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify(data) }) .then(res => res.text()) .then(txt => alert(txt)) .then(txt => transfer(txt)) } return (
{/* */}
{/* */}

Chapter 2: Java Operators and Expressions

4 Types of Operators in Java:

Arithmetic Operators
Operator Name Description Example
 +  Additon  Adds together two values  a+b
 _  Substraction  Substract one value from another  a-b
 *  Multiplication  Multiple two values  a*b
 /  Division  Divides one value by another  a/b
 % Modulus  Returns the division remiander  a%b
 ++  Increment  Increase the value of a variable by 1  ++a
 --  Decrement  Decrease the value of a variable by 1  --a
Assignment Operators
Operator Example Same As
 =  a=5 a=5
 +=  a+=1 a=a+1
 -= a-=2 a=a-2
 *=  a*=3 x=x*3
/= a/=2 a=a/2
 %=  a%=3  x=x%3
 &=  a&=3  a=a&3
|=   a|=3  a=a|3
 ^=  a^=3  a=a^3
 >>=  a>>=3  a=a>>3
 <<=  a<<=3  a=a<<3
Comparision Operators
Operator Name Example
 == Equal to a==b
!= Not equal a!=b
> Greater than a>b
< Less than a<b
>= Greater than or equal to a>=b
 <=  Less than or equal to  a<=b
Logical Operators
Operator Name Description Example
&& Logical and Return true if both statement is true  a<8&&a<1
|| Logical or Return true if one of the statement is true  a<8||a<7
! Logical not Reverse the result, return false if the result is true  !(a<1&&A<4)

Exercise:

As we all know that 1{'>'}0 is true and 100{'>'}20 is true;

Then please use the logic operators to combine these two expression and output false.
Hint: you can use "!","{'&&'}", "()" to connect your statements.
